stories.text:
Previously Compose for iOS not available. As we know Compose multiplatform is powered by Skiko
https://github.com/JetBrains/skiko (a Kotlin MPP binding for Skia). Skiko Does not contain build for iOS. Now Skiko contains build for iOS, MAC arm processor via Kotlin/Native. So we can use Skiko for pure canvas rendering in all platform. It is matter of time they release compose for iOS. So UI also goes multiplatform.
stories.title: Compose Multiplatform for iOS

stories.text:
I heard many horror stories about people getting unexpected fat bills from cloud providers like AWS and GCP, I think removing unused resources could be a remedy for such situations and I'm wondering how people are doing that ?

I just found out about cloud-nuke[1] for AWS and SafeScrub[2] for GCP.

[1]: https://github.com/gruntwork-io/cloud-nuke

[2]: https://github.com/doitintl/safescrub
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you get rid of unused cloud resources
